Issues.Title: Adjust error message on backport GHA
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

## Proposed changes

Clarify the error message on backport github action

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

None - purely internal engineering change

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Background

Backport GHA can fail for contributers without publicly visible membership within the org owning the repo. Current error message is missleading (by hardcoding the org to 'microsoft').
Thanks to @dreddy-work for helping to investigate this case!

Issues.Title: Form designer is not loaded successfully when switching application's target framework from 7.0 to 8.0 in project's properties window
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22512.32

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro when switching application's target framework from .Net 6.0 to .Net 7.0

### Issue description

Form designer cannot be loaded successfully when switching application's target framework from 7.0 to 8.0 in project's properties window
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/195561960-93cd1357-279a-4618-b55a-b314c7167bc3.png)

### More Info
1. This issue cannot repro when creating Winforms .Net 8.0 application directly
2. This issue cannot repro when changing target framework in application's csproj file from net7.0-windows to net8.0-windows directly 

### Steps to reproduce

**Repro steps:**
1. Create a Winforms **.Net 7.0** application
3. In Solution Explorer, right click application node, and choose **Properties** 
4. Expand Target framework, choose .Net 8.0
5. Build this application

There has an error in csproj file about missing -windows, then add it 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/195563185-377b6e27-b58f-4234-889a-f48b0cc5f936.png)

6. Build this application again without any error
7. Open form designer again

Result: Form designer is loaded very long time, and failed finally with an error
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form designer is not loaded successfully when switching application's target framework from 7.0 to 8.0 in project's properties window" (#7939)

Issues.Title: For MaskedTextBox with Mask setting, the Name property in Inspect should be empty
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22512.32

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in previous .Net versions: 7.0/6.0

### Issue description

For MaskedTextBox with Mask setting, the Name property in Inspect should be empty. This issue is regressed from PR fixing: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7741

**Actual result:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/195556178-52ce34c6-1a6a-44a5-ae23-89d84a2f75dd.png)

**Expected result:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/195556623-ffa6df7c-0daa-4785-b76a-395ec74a9619.png)


### Steps to reproduce

**Repro steps:**
1.	Create a Winforms .Net 8.0 application
2.	Add several maskedTextBox controls
3.	Set them with different mask: PhoneNumeber, ShortDate
4.	Build and run application, use Inspect to check these controls' Name property

or use this attached sample application:
[WinFormsApp8.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9774999/WinFormsApp8.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "For MaskedTextBox with Mask setting, the Name property in Inspect should be empty" (#7938)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/7.0] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#7934)

Issues.Title: Convert file dialog COM usage to CsWin32
Issues.Body:
Directly uses COM pointers when accessing the native dialog.

This also rewrites the CCW for the dialog options to use the CsWin32 generated interface and moves the statics into the CsWin32 COM struct (which is partial).

Adds better helpers to initialize vtables and find the CCW for a given object.

Removes our DECIMAL and BSTR definitions.

Adds an enum helper for setting/clearing flags based on a boolean value.

Issues.Title: Remove duplicate `StatusCommandUI`
Issues.Body:
It appears a genuine porting mistake introduced in #606. `StatusCommandUI` only ever existed under System.Windows.Forms.Design namespace, and the type was later correctly ported in #632.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/194977667-6e94d3c3-08f3-458c-8ab4-06776bda4fd1.png)
